name: LIHEAP
description: Up to $3,000 per year to help pay energy bills, avoid disconnection, and pay for energy efficiency improvements and energy-related home repairs
fullDescription: The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) is a federally funded program that helps low-income households pay their energy bills and make energy-efficient home improvements.
whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $3,000 per year for energy bill assistance
- Help preventing utility disconnection
- Energy efficiency improvements (weatherization)
- Energy-related home repairs
- Crisis assistance for emergencies
- Assistance with heating and cooling costs
howToGetIt:
1. Find your local LIHEAP provider through CSD website
2. Check income eligibility (typically 60% of state median income)
3. Gather documents: ID, utility bills, income verification
4. Submit application through local Community Action Agency
5. If approved, payment goes directly to utility company
